sense.def:
A step
je gib, ki ga naredimo z nogo, ko jo dvignemo in položimo drugam.

seg.quote: I walked on with quick steps.

sense.def:
To step on something
pomeni položiti stopalo na nekaj.

seg.quote: He had stepped on a thorn.

sense.def:
To step in a particular direction
pomeni premakniti se v določeno smer.

A step
je tudi ena od vrste stopenj ali eno samo dejanje, storjeno v določen namen.

seg.quote: Today's announcement is a step in the right direction.
Simmel carried this idea one step further.

sense.def:
A step
je tudi dvignjena ploska površina, pogosto ena v vrsti, na katero položimo stopalo, da stopimo navzgor ali navzdol na drugačno višino.

seg.quote: She was sitting on the top step.

sense.def:
Kadar nam kdo reče
watch your step
, nas opozarja, naj bomo previdnejši pri svojem vedênju, da ne bomo zašli v težave.

seg.quote: I'm cleverer than you are, so watch your step.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj počnemo
step by step
, to počnemo postopoma, od ene stopnje do naslednje.

seg.quote: The proof is set out, step by step, on page 6.

sense.def:
To walk in step
pomeni pomikati stopala naprej v skupini oseb ob istem času kot vsi drugi.

seg.quote: ...a party of boys marching in step.

sense.def:
To step back
pomeni razmisliti o določenem položaju drugače in nepristransko.

seg.quote: It is tempting to step back and ask whether it is worth all the trouble.

sense.def:
To step down
ali
to step aside
pomeni dati ostavko na pomembno službeno mesto ali položaj.

seg.quote: He stepped down last month because of illness.

sense.def:
To step in
pomeni začeti pomagati v težavnem položaju.

seg.quote: She really appreciates the way you stepped in and saw to things.

sense.def:
To step up something
pomeni nekaj povečati.

seg.quote: The government is stepping up its efforts.
